agent object is a member of some sub classes of RouterInfo such as
HaRouter. This changeset makes it a member of the RouterInfo class
itself.

Prior to the change, the agent object has been passed in to some
methods of RouterInfo that requires it to access the agent object's
member information. The bugs in concern requires calling the PD object
that is a member of the agent object to get IPs that need to be
preserved in the gateway port. Without this change, signatures of the
methods external_gateway_added() and external_gateway_updated() have
to be modified to pass in the agent object. And any subclass of
RouterInfo that overwrites or uses the methods must be changed as
well. It doesn't seem to make sense considering the subclass such as
HaRouter has the agent object as one of its members already.

The changeset fixes the bugs by preserving the LLAs for prefix
delegation when the gateway port is being updated.

Closes-Bug: #1639042
Closes-Bug: #1640271

Change-Id: I61c6128ed1973deb8440c54234e77a66987d7e28
"}]
commit_message:
Add agent object in router info

agent object is a member of some sub classes of RouterInfo such as
HaRouter. This changeset makes it a member of the RouterInfo class
itself.

Prior to the change, the agent object has been passed in to some
methods of RouterInfo that requires it to access the agent object's
member information. The bugs in concern requires calling the PD object
that is a member of the agent object to get IPs that need to be
preserved in the gateway port. Without this change, signatures of the
methods external_gateway_added() and external_gateway_updated() have
to be modified to pass in the agent object. And any subclass of
RouterInfo that overwrites or uses the methods must be changed as
well. It doesn't seem to make sense considering the subclass such as
HaRouter has the agent object as one of its members already.

The changeset fixes the bugs by preserving the LLAs for prefix
delegation when the gateway port is being updated.

Closes-Bug: #1639042
Closes-Bug: #1640271

Change-Id: I61c6128ed1973deb8440c54234e77a66987d7e28

commit_message:
Ignore interfaces with @ in the name

ohai reports interface name as br-bm.755@br-bm if device is vlan subinterface
on the bridge.
This patch skip interfaces with such names.

Change-Id: I17fe2276ca5e6cddd38f70f44f1275eb97814a26
Closes-Bug: #1592361

commit_message:
Allow setting default_share_type config option

This config option is needed for setting up default
share type. Note that setting this option does not
create the share type itself (this still has to be
done manually and will be addressed in a future patch).

commit_message:
Update settings file with all available config options

Changes [1] and [2] added new config options in code logic, but
not in settings file. So, add them to settings file too to ease
tracking of configuration options. These two are the only absent
defaults for the moment.

[1] I0c256d0007395e659f804e8874424f4148021ca8
[2] Ia3808486b8604270127c22d45e455e1955b36dba

When a release-specific image was used, there was a way to get the
release under test. Now that a generic image is used, the release
is not discoverable by the same method.

required for the OVB stack cleanup script.

Change-Id: I2c9303ead5add80281d08ec0692885bb26705c17

commit_message:
Remove --release argument from the OVB stack cleanup script

When a release-specific image was used, there was a way to get the
release under test. Now that a generic image is used, the release
is not discoverable by the same method.
This commit removes the release argument - which should not be
required for the OVB stack cleanup script.

Change-Id: I2c9303ead5add80281d08ec0692885bb26705c17

commit_message:
Build role: support using sources from directory

Support copying sources from ready directories in addition
to cloning from repository. It's good both for CI -
when using cloned by ZUUL repos and for local development.
Remove built data from previous runs from DLRN folder.

Change-Id: I99ec5dfcc2ca05d133a125e6d53383ff86c65e1c

subject: If the flavor_id not in full_flavors, don't make a new API request
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-10 10:44:00.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/views.py'], 'message': "If the flavor_id not in full_flavors, don't make a new API request

Flavours are cached from api.nova.flavor_list(), therefore if we have
machine for which flavour is not in the obtained list, it means the
machine has been created using flavour which is not available anymore.
Additional API calls are just decreasing the performance.

Change-Id: I2edab48d49687d400a276124ac812a1de0155628
Closes-bug: #1655300
"}]
commit_message:
If the flavor_id not in full_flavors, don't make a new API request

Flavours are cached from api.nova.flavor_list(), therefore if we have
machine for which flavour is not in the obtained list, it means the
machine has been created using flavour which is not available anymore.
Additional API calls are just decreasing the performance.

Change-Id: I2edab48d49687d400a276124ac812a1de0155628
Closes-bug: #1655300

subject: Enable oslo_middleware proxy header parsing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-09 16:10:51.000000000', 'files': ['templates/heat.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Enable oslo_middleware proxy header parsing

Heat has moved to using oslo_middleware for the http proxy header
parsing, however the default is to not parse the headers.  When
the external protocol differs from the internal protocol this
parsing is required in order for heat to work properly since it
will return 302 redirects to the client during some operations
(such as delete stack).

An example of this is when using haproxy with https configured
for the external protocol and http for the internal protocol.
If the oslo_middleware does not parse the headers, then any
302 redirects would specify a url with http rather than
correctly specifying https and the heat client would fail to
connect on the redirect url.

Change-Id: I0a331a0e766a77c8c8fed3fd22f0b36f2a5a9e5a
Closes-bug: #1654874
'}]
commit_message:
Enable oslo_middleware proxy header parsing

Heat has moved to using oslo_middleware for the http proxy header
parsing, however the default is to not parse the headers.  When
the external protocol differs from the internal protocol this
parsing is required in order for heat to work properly since it
will return 302 redirects to the client during some operations
(such as delete stack).

An example of this is when using haproxy with https configured
for the external protocol and http for the internal protocol.
If the oslo_middleware does not parse the headers, then any
302 redirects would specify a url with http rather than
correctly specifying https and the heat client would fail to
connect on the redirect url.

Change-Id: I0a331a0e766a77c8c8fed3fd22f0b36f2a5a9e5a
Closes-bug: #1654874

commit_message:
Remove nova net support from service_instance

Nova network was deprecated in Newton and is no longer supported for
regular deployments in Ocata [1].

As a first step towards removal and cleanup of nova network plugin
from manila, remove support for it from the service instance module.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/nova/unreleased.html

Partially-implements: bp remove-nova-net-plugin

Change-Id: I846b760fa7c01f7f86768399a2bfad9ced7e57cd

subject: Fix Ceph backed Nova snapshot
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-20 16:49:50.000000000', 'files': ['templates/glance-api.conf.j2', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Fix Ceph backed Nova snapshot

When both Glance and Nova are Ceph backed the instance snapshot
path can do a direct snapshot which leaves image bits in the Ceph
cluster.

At Newton and Ocata levels this requires show_multiple_locations=True
set in the glance API conf.  See [1].  Despite the Ceph doc stating
Mitaka also needs this, an OSA deployment of Mitaka has been found to
work without it.

Without this fix an OpenStack Ansible deployment wih Ceph
backed Nova and Glance will fail with symptoms as documented in [2].

A similar fix was put into DevStack under [3].

[1] http://docs.ceph.com/docs/master/rbd/rbd-openstack/#for-mitaka-only
[2] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1382737
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/279630/

Change-Id: I52db9b5baf9209c72513da9c5f08e650ba6d43df
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Ceph backed Nova snapshot

When both Glance and Nova are Ceph backed the instance snapshot
path can do a direct snapshot which leaves image bits in the Ceph
cluster.

At Newton and Ocata levels this requires show_multiple_locations=True
set in the glance API conf.  See [1].  Despite the Ceph doc stating
Mitaka also needs this, an OSA deployment of Mitaka has been found to
work without it.

Without this fix an OpenStack Ansible deployment wih Ceph
backed Nova and Glance will fail with symptoms as documented in [2].

A similar fix was put into DevStack under [3].

[1] http://docs.ceph.com/docs/master/rbd/rbd-openstack/#for-mitaka-only
[2] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1382737
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/279630/

Change-Id: I52db9b5baf9209c72513da9c5f08e650ba6d43df

commit_message:
Add UI Tests for Filtering Components by Name/Tag/Description.

Added UI tests for filtering components by above attributes
in the environment details view.

Added tests for the following 4 scenarios:
  - Filter components by name.
  - Filter components by tag.
  - Filter components by description.
  - Filter components that return many results that overflow
    past the components carousel and check whether all results
    are present in the DOM.

Change-Id: I5e616ef79e9e065fd2615982ae6bec58e1171c23
Depends-On: Ifecba6563877de7d28b3d3ab4e2b77774b993c7e

subject: Added the releasenotes
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-01-10 11:09:46.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/.placeholder', 'releasenotes/source/unreleased.rst', 'test-requirements.txt', 'releasenotes/source/_static/.placeholder', 'releasenotes/source/_templates/.placeholder', 'releasenotes/source/index.rst', 'tox.ini', 'releasenotes/source/conf.py'], 'message': 'Added the releasenotes

All the components of openstack maintain releasenotes. Similarly,
python-vitrageclient must also maintain releasenotes. This adds
the releasenotes directory to the vitrageclient repo.

commit_message:
Added the releasenotes

All the components of openstack maintain releasenotes. Similarly,
python-vitrageclient must also maintain releasenotes. This adds
the releasenotes directory to the vitrageclient repo.

Change-Id: I74e9f10da38b3e11888b3d00f78fd61b2910a46c
Implements: blueprint maintain-releasenotes

subject: Use keystoneauth1 for cinder access
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2017-01-05 21:27:42.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'fuxi/common/config.py', 'fuxi/opts.py', 'devstack/local.conf.sample', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'fuxi/utils.py', 'devstack/settings'], 'message': 'Use keystoneauth1 for cinder access

The goal is to add support for keystone v3, while still maintain
backward-compatibility. In particular, it did the following:
* Use keystoneauth1 for keystone authentication
* Deprecate the usage of keystoneclient.auth, which is the legacy
  way of doing authentication. It seems to support keystone v2
  only, which cause the problem.
* Introduce new auth session in config file.
* Deprecate old auth session in config file.

Closes-Bug: #1563011
Change-Id: Ia80b4377eda6314ad8e6287cb65eb2842f972b8b
'}]
commit_message:
Use keystoneauth1 for cinder access

The goal is to add support for keystone v3, while still maintain
backward-compatibility. In particular, it did the following:
* Use keystoneauth1 for keystone authentication
* Deprecate the usage of keystoneclient.auth, which is the legacy
  way of doing authentication. It seems to support keystone v2
  only, which cause the problem.
* Introduce new auth session in config file.
* Deprecate old auth session in config file.

Closes-Bug: #1563011
Change-Id: Ia80b4377eda6314ad8e6287cb65eb2842f972b8b

subject: Run automated cleaning in the HA job on Ocata and newer
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-01-08 17:17:16.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/deploy.sh', 'toci_gate_test.sh'], 'message': "Run automated cleaning in the HA job on Ocata and newer

Cleaning is an important feature which is enabled by default in upstream
ironic. In addition to wiping hard drives automatically, it's also the basis
of features like RAID or firmware configuration.
We need to test it to ensure that undercloud is compatible with these features.

The HA job is picked, because the non-HA one is running introspection, which
is another relatively long-running process.

Change-Id: I6c6fb22964ae2d239074c9ea2a76120e4395e45b
Implements: blueprint re-enable-cleaning
"}]
commit_message:
Run automated cleaning in the HA job on Ocata and newer

Cleaning is an important feature which is enabled by default in upstream
ironic. In addition to wiping hard drives automatically, it's also the basis
of features like RAID or firmware configuration.
We need to test it to ensure that undercloud is compatible with these features.

The HA job is picked, because the non-HA one is running introspection, which
is another relatively long-running process.

Change-Id: I6c6fb22964ae2d239074c9ea2a76120e4395e45b
Implements: blueprint re-enable-cleaning

subject: If the flavor_id not in full_flavors, don’t make a new API request
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-10 10:43:02.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/views.py'], 'message': 'If the flavor_id not in full_flavors, don’t make a new API request

Flavours are cached from api.nova.flavor_list(), therefore if we have
machine for which flavour is not in the obtained list, it means the
machine has been created using flavour which is not available anymore.
Additional API calls are just decreasing the performance.

Change-Id: Ia1945f68c8c35e11dcd1381d639b0334848a5c35
Closes-bug: #1655300
'}]
commit_message:
If the flavor_id not in full_flavors, don’t make a new API request

Flavours are cached from api.nova.flavor_list(), therefore if we have
machine for which flavour is not in the obtained list, it means the
machine has been created using flavour which is not available anymore.
Additional API calls are just decreasing the performance.

Change-Id: Ia1945f68c8c35e11dcd1381d639b0334848a5c35
Closes-bug: #1655300

commit_message:
Fix VBoxManage search on Windows

The way we set the PATH variable in Windows does not work. If the
VBoxManage binary is in a non-standard location, the scripts fail.

This patch implements an alternative method that works without
trying to change PATH.

Change-Id: I15df18038152d4c69e792e911cd104a9df64516f

commit_message:
Ensure RHEL 6 STIG content is used

The RHEL 7 STIG content in the security role is ready to be enabled
as the default for deployers who consume only the security role itself.
However, the new content isn't ready for the integrated repo.

This patch ensures that RHEL 6 STIG content is used in the integrated
repo even if the security role itself switches to enable RHEL 7 content
as the default.

Change-Id: I1b7ceb90673e07c7fc5a2c882c84a56aa1d5877a

subject: Fix venv build fallback mechanism
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-01-10 04:32:19.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/nova_compute_kvm_install.yml', 'tasks/nova_console_novnc_install.yml', 'tasks/nova_install.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Fix venv build fallback mechanism

Fixes the ability to deploy a venv in cases where:
1) developer_mode is not enabled
2) A cached venv is not downloaded from the repo server

Also introduced is a var that can be used to disable the cached venv
download attempt entirely and force the fallback behavior. Previously
that would have been available by simply setting the venv download
to some broken URL like "http://localhost/none", but
nova_venv_download will allow for much easier disabling of the
cached venv download behavior.

Change-Id: Id41233789047906a0eb5f1af4d0d6b4dde55d8c7
'}]
commit_message:
Fix venv build fallback mechanism

Fixes the ability to deploy a venv in cases where:
1) developer_mode is not enabled
2) A cached venv is not downloaded from the repo server

Also introduced is a var that can be used to disable the cached venv
download attempt entirely and force the fallback behavior. Previously
that would have been available by simply setting the venv download
to some broken URL like "http://localhost/none", but
nova_venv_download will allow for much easier disabling of the
cached venv download behavior.

Change-Id: Id41233789047906a0eb5f1af4d0d6b4dde55d8c7

commit_message:
Fix venv build fallback mechanism

Fixes the ability to deploy a venv in cases where:
1) developer_mode is not enabled
2) A cached venv is not downloaded from the repo server

Also introduced is a var that can be used to disable the cached venv
download attempt entirely and force the fallback behavior. Previously
that would have been available by simply setting the venv download
to some broken URL like "http://localhost/none", but
neutron_venv_download will allow for much easier disabling of the
cached venv download behavior.

Change-Id: Ib1b8f2d3710dc3532abc818956a265f1095505b4

Change-Id: If0efa366f70dacb5a7946f7978d9b2a15889be95

commit_message:
Set extradisks for Ceph storage nodes

While it is possible to run a Ceph OSD without additional devices,
it is useful to have dedicated devices for it to not fill up the
host disk space. This change sets extradisks=True for cephstorage
nodes as it is for objectstorage nodes.

Change-Id: If0efa366f70dacb5a7946f7978d9b2a15889be95

subject: Use domain_id when testing keystone_user password
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-07 00:31:50.000000000', 'files': ['spec/unit/provider/keystone_user/openstack_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/keystone_user/openstack.rb'], 'message': 'Use domain_id when testing keystone_user password

Older python-openstackclient crashes with this error if no project or
domain are passed to the openstack token issue command:

  Set a scope, such as a project or domain, with --os-project-name or OS_PROJECT_NAME

The @property_hash[:domain] value is not properly populated at this time,
making the "openstack token issue" command being invoked without proper scope.

The @property_hash[:domain_id] value is however available. Using the domain_id
instead makes both older and recent python-openstackclient happy.

Closes-bug: #1654379
Change-Id: Ie23bdb7e9dd77e6ec4358c68d77671ef3c0678a6
(cherry picked from commit 3010079b0a843cd3aa36a2c29bd3858e67013f74)
'}]
commit_message:
Use domain_id when testing keystone_user password

Older python-openstackclient crashes with this error if no project or
domain are passed to the openstack token issue command:

  Set a scope, such as a project or domain, with --os-project-name or OS_PROJECT_NAME

The @property_hash[:domain] value is not properly populated at this time,
making the "openstack token issue" command being invoked without proper scope.

The @property_hash[:domain_id] value is however available. Using the domain_id
instead makes both older and recent python-openstackclient happy.

Closes-bug: #1654379
Change-Id: Ie23bdb7e9dd77e6ec4358c68d77671ef3c0678a6
(cherry picked from commit 3010079b0a843cd3aa36a2c29bd3858e67013f74)

By default stevedore.named logger runs in INFO level, which produces
WARNING messages every time code attempts to import driver with full
path to driver class. Such WARNING is useless and floods e.g. dhcp agent

'}]
commit_message:
Set stevedore.named logger to ERROR level

By default stevedore.named logger runs in INFO level, which produces
WARNING messages every time code attempts to import driver with full
path to driver class. Such WARNING is useless and floods e.g. dhcp agent
logs every time dhcp agent creates new dhcp namespace and plugs port.

Change-Id: Icc18e60b2f01235d97d0a4c6a1d773236ff176b5
Closes-bug: 1649965

commit_message:
Plugin rename is denied

Plugin name is uses as identifier in sync operations. Plugins data
on the file system can be found only by it's name, so renaming of
the plugin must be denied.

Change-Id: I2864537770f27d3b95d0d093900c1a787fef107c
Closes-Bug: #1649568

subject: using sys.exit(main()) instead of main()
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-09 00:29:13.000000000', 'files': ['tools/install_venv.py'], 'message': "using sys.exit(main()) instead of main()

As we known, Exceptions are raised by the sys.exit() function.
When they are not handled, no stack traceback is printed in the
Python interpreter. In this patch we have known main() got return
values(eg:0, 1), but it can't specifies exit status when terminate
the main thread by unusing sys.exit(). So when using sys.exit(main())
instead of main() may be more readable and reasonable.

Change-Id: Ib2b1d8683409290f78d2366dc25d4387a72065bc
"}]
commit_message:
using sys.exit(main()) instead of main()

As we known, Exceptions are raised by the sys.exit() function.
When they are not handled, no stack traceback is printed in the
Python interpreter. In this patch we have known main() got return
values(eg:0, 1), but it can't specifies exit status when terminate
the main thread by unusing sys.exit(). So when using sys.exit(main())
instead of main() may be more readable and reasonable.

Change-Id: Ib2b1d8683409290f78d2366dc25d4387a72065bc

subject: Add logging to parser.py
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-06 13:37:57.000000000', 'files': ['rst2bash/parser.py'], 'message': 'Add logging to parser.py

This patch adds logging to parser.py. All log entries are written to a
log file. Log entries at a level higher than debug level are also
written to the console.

The patch uses logging to make it easy to diagnose parsing errors caused
by mismatched start and end markers for distro and code blocks.

Change-Id: Ieea40d58aaf827ef9ba2e4eec75c450c5a58ea27
'}]
commit_message:
Add logging to parser.py

This patch adds logging to parser.py. All log entries are written to a
log file. Log entries at a level higher than debug level are also
written to the console.

The patch uses logging to make it easy to diagnose parsing errors caused
by mismatched start and end markers for distro and code blocks.

Change-Id: Ieea40d58aaf827ef9ba2e4eec75c450c5a58ea27

subject: move aclmanager.py from release-tools repo
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-09 14:45:06.000000000', 'files': ['PROCESS.rst', 'README.rst', 'tools/aclmanager.py'], 'message': 'move aclmanager.py from release-tools repo

The aclmanager script needs to be able to get a list of repositories
with the cycle-with-milestone release model, and the data for that lives
in this repository now instead of the governance repository. Rather than
having a tool that relies on this data live in release-tools, move it
here.

Change-Id: I7c2c54c4949829aea92e569e3ac9ec9007d932ed
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
move aclmanager.py from release-tools repo

The aclmanager script needs to be able to get a list of repositories
with the cycle-with-milestone release model, and the data for that lives
in this repository now instead of the governance repository. Rather than
having a tool that relies on this data live in release-tools, move it
here.

Change-Id: I7c2c54c4949829aea92e569e3ac9ec9007d932ed
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Disable creation of public shares per configuration

Fix [1] for bug [2] disabled creating of public share types
per configuration but did not address the part of the bug
that required disabling of public *share* creation per
configuration.

Fix that here.

[1] Ia3808486b8604270127c22d45e455e1955b36dba
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/manila-ui/+bug/1593057

Change-Id: I0c256d0007395e659f804e8874424f4148021ca8
Closes-bug: #1650610

commit_message:
Python3 common patterns

Modify some codes in order to make them meet
the Python3 common pattern.
In this patch,I replace filter(lambda obj: test(obj),data)
with[obj for obj in data if test(obj)]

Change-Id: I68e76f91dc31aa0e00124c1eb76a0a1f0178cc44

subject: Update and clean up run_tests.sh
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-06 16:55:11.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh'], 'message': 'Update and clean up run_tests.sh

The run_tests.sh script fails when it is run multiple times on CentOS.
The `bindep` run returns an empty list of packages and then `yum`
exits with an error since no packages were provided to install.

This patch checks the length of the `bindep` output and skips the `yum`
installation when the package list is empty.

The patch also cleans up some of the old cruft left over from previous
scripts and avoids repetition.

Change-Id: I41c0fb1f611507bab648c611fba751f4e114a89b
Signed-off-by: Major Hayden <major@mhtx.net>
'}]
commit_message:
Update and clean up run_tests.sh

The run_tests.sh script fails when it is run multiple times on CentOS.
The `bindep` run returns an empty list of packages and then `yum`
exits with an error since no packages were provided to install.

This patch checks the length of the `bindep` output and skips the `yum`
installation when the package list is empty.

The patch also cleans up some of the old cruft left over from previous
scripts and avoids repetition.

Change-Id: I41c0fb1f611507bab648c611fba751f4e114a89b
Signed-off-by: Major Hayden <major@mhtx.net>

commit_message:
Use more specific asserts in tests

Instead of assertTrue and assertFalse use more specific asserts.
They are compatible with Python 2.7[1] and 3.4[2]

[1]: https://docs.python.org/2.7/library/unittest.html
[2]: https://docs.python.org/3.4/library/unittest.html

Change-Id: I94cfb5353f9bee227e3ba0fa3ce0b1e09be93ddb

subject: Allow Apache ports to be specified per VHost
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-09 14:56:53.000000000', 'files': ['templates/keystone-httpd.conf.j2', 'templates/keystone-ports.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Allow Apache ports to be specified per VHost

With more services moving to an Apache2 model, having a ports.conf file
becomes unmanageable - we should instead add the Listen line to each
Vhost and set a blank "ports.conf".

Change-Id: I58b12b799d15ad84e1c40125aba492109cdcb130
'}]
commit_message:
Allow Apache ports to be specified per VHost

With more services moving to an Apache2 model, having a ports.conf file
becomes unmanageable - we should instead add the Listen line to each
Vhost and set a blank "ports.conf".

Change-Id: I58b12b799d15ad84e1c40125aba492109cdcb130

The run_tests.sh script fails when it is run multiple times on CentOS.
The `bindep` run returns an empty list of packages and then `yum`
exits with an error since no packages were provided to install.

This patch checks the length of the `bindep` output and skips the `yum`
installation when the package list is empty.

The patch also cleans up some of the old cruft left over from previous
scripts and avoids repetition.

Signed-off-by: Major Hayden <major@mhtx.net>

subject: Ensure all cinder_backends are created
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-04 11:43:43.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tests/inventory', 'tasks/cinder_backends.yml', 'tests/host_vars/cinder_vol.yml'], 'message': 'Ensure all cinder_backends are created

Combine all cinder_volume host's "cinder_backends" var to ensure all
cinder_backends are created, and there is no race condition setting up
the same backend for multiple hosts (e.g. rbd backends which exist on
multiple volume servers).

This adds a second cinder_volume node for testing, with a new backend,
as well as the old backend - this should ensure duplicate backends are
not created whilst backends are created for each cinder_volumes host.

Change-Id: I1c2fb1ef07423fc415622767ff09f058c773c1ed
Closes-Bug: 1649914
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure all cinder_backends are created

Combine all cinder_volume host's "cinder_backends" var to ensure all
cinder_backends are created, and there is no race condition setting up
the same backend for multiple hosts (e.g. rbd backends which exist on
multiple volume servers).

This adds a second cinder_volume node for testing, with a new backend,
as well as the old backend - this should ensure duplicate backends are
not created whilst backends are created for each cinder_volumes host.

Change-Id: I1c2fb1ef07423fc415622767ff09f058c773c1ed
Closes-Bug: 1649914

subject: Replace six.iteritems with dict.items()
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-22 09:34:55.000000000', 'files': ['vitrage/common/utils.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems with dict.items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems
to achieve iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will
return iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, 
see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ia21d66e927380cacfd480fb58707a6c66db4b609
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems with dict.items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems
to achieve iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will
return iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, 
see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ia21d66e927380cacfd480fb58707a6c66db4b609

subject: Avoid error if optional format fields are absent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-10 09:48:49.000000000', 'files': ['osc_lib/utils.py'], 'message': 'Avoid error if optional format fields are absent

Neutron has several fields which are optional and enabled via
extensions by the Operator. These fields are required by the
user, if the extension is enabled. But if the extension is disabled,
the output of a Create-* command might fail if the formatter
is of a dict/list object type.

This patch tries to resolve this issue, by verifying if data related
to the format for the optional fields are present or not.

Closes-Bug :#1654984

Change-Id: I97f804af7f99db79a78f4b7ded1b911dada7e936
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid error if optional format fields are absent

Neutron has several fields which are optional and enabled via
extensions by the Operator. These fields are required by the
user, if the extension is enabled. But if the extension is disabled,
the output of a Create-* command might fail if the formatter
is of a dict/list object type.

This patch tries to resolve this issue, by verifying if data related
to the format for the optional fields are present or not.

Closes-Bug :#1654984

Change-Id: I97f804af7f99db79a78f4b7ded1b911dada7e936

commit_message:
fixed cluster::mysql requires mysql client installed

cluster::mysql calls `mysql` command in create-init-file
However mysql client package is not installed at a moment,
when this command is executed. Thus it fails.

Change-Id: Iaf4dd8f8ffe58e47bef07df04952d889a8c32212
Closes-Bug: #1638904
Signed-off-by: Pavel Glushchak <pglushchak@virtuozzo.com>

commit_message:
Use only first two number from version in repositories file names

Otherwise during plugin update it creates multiple repository files.


Closes-bug: #1513956
Change-Id: Ie2e8288b3b701f07cb3c180e9b919860b7db562e
(cherry picked from commit 77e29ab206937efa05746451ebe86f94eb428a7f)

commit_message:
Update and clean up run_tests.sh

The run_tests.sh script fails when it is run multiple times on CentOS.
The `bindep` run returns an empty list of packages and then `yum`
exits with an error since no packages were provided to install.

This patch checks the length of the `bindep` output and skips the `yum`
installation when the package list is empty.

commit_message:
Make update-from-keystone-admin-internal-api.yaml work on newton+

There are change of ServiceNetMapDefaults in service_net_map.j2.yaml but
were not reproduce in update-from-keystone-admin-internal-api.yaml
environment. Tested in newton.

Closes-Bug: #1646862

Change-Id: I307dcaabbc6d583896090bf3f046b442007fbc42
Signed-off-by: Cyril Lopez <cylopez@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Gregory Charot <gcharot@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update and clean up run_tests.sh

The run_tests.sh script fails when it is run multiple times on CentOS.
The `bindep` run returns an empty list of packages and then `yum`
exits with an error since no packages were provided to install.

This patch checks the length of the `bindep` output and skips the `yum`
installation when the package list is empty.

The patch also cleans up some of the old cruft left over from previous
scripts and avoids repetition.

Change-Id: I7c62831bdb367beadaf30ab99e2f945ccdec3f32
Signed-off-by: Major Hayden <major@mhtx.net>

commit_message:
Cleanup temporary files after content argument usage

When using content: the config_template module will create a
temporary file. This patch ensures a deterministic path to the
temp file is used, and removes it at the end of the module
execution.

Change-Id: I3b3354178ba1a2b9c95decb3d3e0c9a1c2689056

subject: Fix warning from PyCharm: Default argument value is mutable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-09 13:14:43.000000000', 'files': ['vitrage/datasources/transformer_base.py'], 'message': 'Fix warning from PyCharm: Default argument value is mutable

> This inspection detects when a mutable value as list or dictionary is
> detected in a default value for an argument. Default argument values
> are evaluated only once at function definition time, which means that
> modifying the default value of the argument will affect all subsequent
> calls of the function.

Change-Id: Ia9c5928af3ef8d77f1885d7ddc2032433a13a6e2
Signed-off-by: Yujun Zhang <zhang.yujunz@zte.com.cn>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix warning from PyCharm: Default argument value is mutable

> This inspection detects when a mutable value as list or dictionary is
> detected in a default value for an argument. Default argument values
> are evaluated only once at function definition time, which means that
> modifying the default value of the argument will affect all subsequent
> calls of the function.

Change-Id: Ia9c5928af3ef8d77f1885d7ddc2032433a13a6e2
Signed-off-by: Yujun Zhang <zhang.yujunz@zte.com.cn>

subject: neutron: kill non-dvr OVS scenario
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-22 15:52:13.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/neutron.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': 'neutron: kill non-dvr OVS scenario

The project is moving into DVR+HA direction for all gate jobs. At this
point, adding jobs that are not DVR+HA is counterproductive.

Of course, since Linuxbridge does not work with DVR yet, we keep that
other scenario job flavour as-is. But there is no excuse to care about
that non-dvr OVS job.

Change-Id: I7b029acd19d8705882792a0aa6ae4aac68a4253e
'}]
commit_message:
neutron: kill non-dvr OVS scenario

The project is moving into DVR+HA direction for all gate jobs. At this
point, adding jobs that are not DVR+HA is counterproductive.

Of course, since Linuxbridge does not work with DVR yet, we keep that
other scenario job flavour as-is. But there is no excuse to care about
that non-dvr OVS job.

Change-Id: I7b029acd19d8705882792a0aa6ae4aac68a4253e

subject: Reduce our 3-node labels to min-ready 0
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-09 21:02:04.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/nodepool.yaml'], 'message': 'Reduce our 3-node labels to min-ready 0

While we have jobs using these labels today, they are still used very
little. Rather then having 6 nodes idle for days at a time, only
launch them when jobs are needed.

On average it takes about 30seconds for nodes to come online these
days.

Change-Id: I8e74b62f3556823e17468a4e2d22d42490fc44e6
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Reduce our 3-node labels to min-ready 0

While we have jobs using these labels today, they are still used very
little. Rather then having 6 nodes idle for days at a time, only
launch them when jobs are needed.

On average it takes about 30seconds for nodes to come online these
days.

Change-Id: I8e74b62f3556823e17468a4e2d22d42490fc44e6
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-06 16:48:42.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh'], 'message': 'Update and clean up run_tests.sh

The run_tests.sh script fails when it is run multiple times on CentOS.
The `bindep` run returns an empty list of packages and then `yum`
exits with an error since no packages were provided to install.

This patch checks the length of the `bindep` output and skips the `yum`
installation when the package list is empty.

The patch also cleans up some of the old cruft left over from previous
scripts and avoids repetition.

Change-Id: I3a659bebd854335c7978b7476bfdbbbff5a46329
Signed-off-by: Major Hayden <major@mhtx.net>
'}]
commit_message:
Update and clean up run_tests.sh

The run_tests.sh script fails when it is run multiple times on CentOS.
The `bindep` run returns an empty list of packages and then `yum`
exits with an error since no packages were provided to install.

This patch checks the length of the `bindep` output and skips the `yum`
installation when the package list is empty.

The patch also cleans up some of the old cruft left over from previous
scripts and avoids repetition.

Change-Id: I3a659bebd854335c7978b7476bfdbbbff5a46329
Signed-off-by: Major Hayden <major@mhtx.net>

The run_tests.sh script fails when it is run multiple times on CentOS.
The `bindep` run returns an empty list of packages and then `yum`
exits with an error since no packages were provided to install.

This patch checks the length of the `bindep` output and skips the `yum`
installation when the package list is empty.

The patch also cleans up some of the old cruft left over from previous
scripts and avoids repetition.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-09 09:40:53.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_rbd.py'], 'message': "RBD: the value of 'had_journaling' has not changed after 'update_features'.

I find that in method '_enable_replication', if the volume has no feature of
'journaling', the value of 'had_journaling' will not be changed before and
after 'update_features', it's always 'None', so, the value of 'bool(had_journaling)'
will always be 'false', this value will be written to database finally. I think that's
a bug. I change the value of 'had_journaling' after 'update_features' by
adding 'had_journaling = image.features() & self.rbd.RBD_FEATURE_JOURNALING'.

Change-Id: I72435d20f2ffd315dc8642c2eb4e2f3f9be2359a
Closes-Bug: #1654126
"}]
commit_message:
RBD: the value of 'had_journaling' has not changed after 'update_features'.

I find that in method '_enable_replication', if the volume has no feature of
'journaling', the value of 'had_journaling' will not be changed before and
after 'update_features', it's always 'None', so, the value of 'bool(had_journaling)'
will always be 'false', this value will be written to database finally. I think that's
a bug. I change the value of 'had_journaling' after 'update_features' by
adding 'had_journaling = image.features() & self.rbd.RBD_FEATURE_JOURNALING'.

Change-Id: I72435d20f2ffd315dc8642c2eb4e2f3f9be2359a
Closes-Bug: #1654126

commit_message:
Distinguish between Java and Python for Mon

Detection plugins for monasca exists in particular for
monasca-api and monasca-persister. However they only support
proper detection of java based implementations.

Following change provides support for python based implementation.

Additionally written several missing unit tests for
Mon* detection plugins.

Fixes-Bug: #1642567
Change-Id: I76df0dec03ade146b96cc59e8dd9f9c394f30262

subject: Default performance schema to off
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-09 22:01:34.000000000', 'files': ['tests/basic_deployment.py', 'config.yaml', 'hooks/percona_hooks.py', 'templates/mysqld.cnf', 'README.md'], 'message': 'Default performance schema to off

The 5.6 version of mysql defauls to performance_schema=on at server
startup. This allocates all the memory that would be required to
handle max-connections plus several other memory settings.

We occasionally saw connection exhaustion in HA clouds with
max-connections near 2000. The common practice became to set
max-connections unrealistically high near 10k or 20k. In the move to
5.6 on Xenial this became a problem as the memory requirements for
values that high are unrealistic.

This change adds performance schema as a configuration option and
defaults to off giving 5.5 like behavior. It also considerably
updates documentation and highlights the need to carefully consider
memory related configuration settings for production environments.

Make the amulet test python2 and python3 capable.

Change-Id: Id01095ac2f73fa041b25b2602496a4c04a13e3ef
Partial-Bug: #1654086
Closes-Bug: #1600001
'}]
commit_message:
Default performance schema to off

The 5.6 version of mysql defauls to performance_schema=on at server
startup. This allocates all the memory that would be required to
handle max-connections plus several other memory settings.

We occasionally saw connection exhaustion in HA clouds with
max-connections near 2000. The common practice became to set
max-connections unrealistically high near 10k or 20k. In the move to
5.6 on Xenial this became a problem as the memory requirements for
values that high are unrealistic.

This change adds performance schema as a configuration option and
defaults to off giving 5.5 like behavior. It also considerably
updates documentation and highlights the need to carefully consider
memory related configuration settings for production environments.

Make the amulet test python2 and python3 capable.

Change-Id: Id01095ac2f73fa041b25b2602496a4c04a13e3ef
Partial-Bug: #1654086
Closes-Bug: #1600001

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-09 16:49:17.000000000', 'files': ['tests/noop/spec/hosts/database/database_spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/manifests/database/database.pp'], 'message': 'Fix apt discrepancy around mysql client package

When we run galera/mysql packages installation
we can get into dependencies issues with  mysql
client package as it is not installed at the time
when perl dbd module requires it. At the same time
libperl-dbd-mysql is depending on it, so it fails.
Instead we need to ensure that mysql client is installed
along with its libraries prior to installing additional
packages for galera.

Change-Id: Idc91a399a46cd63c2201660bb248c0a0ad3fb9b8
Closes-bug: #1651182
'}]
commit_message:
Fix apt discrepancy around mysql client package

When we run galera/mysql packages installation
we can get into dependencies issues with  mysql
client package as it is not installed at the time
when perl dbd module requires it. At the same time
libperl-dbd-mysql is depending on it, so it fails.
Instead we need to ensure that mysql client is installed
along with its libraries prior to installing additional
packages for galera.

Change-Id: Idc91a399a46cd63c2201660bb248c0a0ad3fb9b8
Closes-bug: #1651182

commit_message:
Revert "Ignore heartbeats lock fails"

It seems that there are at least two level of ruby-stomp brokenness and
the fact that the mutex in original commit is locked actually means
there is no heartbeat received in time and we need to do something about
this.

This reverts commit 8318d7056556337f17f596edad9d7eed48ec3ca5.

Partial-Bug: #1644618
Change-Id: I565f430d17bcee2c50c0ddc8ecc11f3dc8b420ed
(cherry picked from commit 13b4d0f38e2a3e1c4d0ac0d91a7bce1dc23d7c8a)

Add DNS name change opportunity

When change DNS hostname in TLS certificate for OpenStack endpoints,
make additional conditions to allow services use new certificate.

Closes-Bug: #1649886

commit_message:
fixed cluster::mysql requires mysql client installed

cluster::mysql calls `mysql` command in create-init-file
However mysql client package is not installed at a moment,
when this command is executed. Thus it fails.

Change-Id: Iaf4dd8f8ffe58e47bef07df04952d889a8c32212
Closes-Bug: #1638904
Signed-off-by: Pavel Glushchak <pglushchak@virtuozzo.com>

commit_message:

Jewel has been the latest stable release for almost a year now and
Hammer was scheduled for EOL in 11/2016.

Reference the following for more information:
http://docs.ceph.com/docs/master/releases/
https://www.spinics.net/lists/ceph-devel/msg34028.html

Change-Id: Id030688c2203cc11ac68a2c988c95b6850217b9f

It was deprecated in Newton timeframe. Now we just clean it up from the
tree.

DocImpact: Any advertise_mtu option notions in documentation should be
removed.

UpgradeImpact: After upgrade, all DHCPv4 subnets will see the MTU option
served via corresponding DHCPv4 option. Also, all IPv6 subnets connected
to routers will see MTU set in Router Advertisement messages.

access the configuration option.

Change-Id: I31e15018fe764de0fe4d6de7da3c1d9f2cc1d532
'}]
commit_message:
Remove advertise_mtu config option

It was deprecated in Newton timeframe. Now we just clean it up from the
tree.

DocImpact: Any advertise_mtu option notions in documentation should be
removed.

UpgradeImpact: After upgrade, all DHCPv4 subnets will see the MTU option
served via corresponding DHCPv4 option. Also, all IPv6 subnets connected
to routers will see MTU set in Router Advertisement messages.

NeutronLibImpact: This patch will break any 3party plugins that directly
access the configuration option.

Change-Id: I31e15018fe764de0fe4d6de7da3c1d9f2cc1d532

commit_message:
Make private network optional

If a fixed_network and fixed_subnet is specified no private network
is created by the templates and the specified network is
used instead for VMs provisioning, like in the Ironic driver.

Currently missing is the code to handle the use case where you
specify a fixed_network but not a fixed_subnet, this will come
in a following patch.

Partially Implements: blueprint decouple-private-network
Change-Id: I2003eb709b22b905063d846eb71570fc5e033618

Add driver variable to ODL tempest jobs

The driver variable is used to determine which driver to use for each
tempest job, the valid options are either v1driver or v2driver.

subject: RBD: the value of 'had_journaling' has not changed after 'update_features'.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15296, 'name': 'Brocade Openstack CI', 'email': 'Brocade-Openstack-CI@Brocade.com', 'username': 'Brocade-Openstack-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 17565, 'name': 'IBM GPFS CI', 'email': 'imanilac@in.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibmmanilaci'}, {'_account_id': 18827, 'name': 'ZTE cinder2 CI', 'email': 'zhou.lichao@zte.com.cn', 'username': 'zteopenstackCI'}, {'_account_id': 22381, 'name': 'Open-E JovianDSS CI', 'email': 'open-e-joviandss-ci@open-e.com', 'username': 'Open-EJovianDSS', 'inactive': True}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-09 09:09:44.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_rbd.py'], 'message': "RBD: the value of 'had_journaling' has not changed after 'update_features'.

I find that in method '_enable_replication', if the volume has no feature of
'journaling', the value of 'had_journaling' will not be changed before and
after 'update_features', it's always 'None', so, the value of 'bool(had_journaling)'
will always be 'false', this value will be written to database finally. I think that's
a bug. I change the value of 'had_journaling' after 'update_features' by
adding 'had_journaling = image.features() & self.rbd.RBD_FEATURE_JOURNALING'.

Change-Id: I4735f303cf22c3f162d6a55b55b300a6900bfed6
Closes-Bug: #1654126
"}]
commit_message:
RBD: the value of 'had_journaling' has not changed after 'update_features'.

I find that in method '_enable_replication', if the volume has no feature of
'journaling', the value of 'had_journaling' will not be changed before and
after 'update_features', it's always 'None', so, the value of 'bool(had_journaling)'
will always be 'false', this value will be written to database finally. I think that's
a bug. I change the value of 'had_journaling' after 'update_features' by
adding 'had_journaling = image.features() & self.rbd.RBD_FEATURE_JOURNALING'.

Change-Id: I4735f303cf22c3f162d6a55b55b300a6900bfed6
Closes-Bug: #1654126

Change-Id: I66d515b9f527c8741b022020d136643159a159f2
'}]
commit_message:
Add trove classifiers for Python

Document the Python versions that we expect this to work with which
include Python 2.7 and Python 3.5.

Change-Id: I66d515b9f527c8741b022020d136643159a159f2

subject: Allow storlet header parameters value to have ':' symbols
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-03 08:58:02.000000000', 'files': ['storlets/swift_middleware/handlers/base.py', 'tests/unit/swift_middleware/handlers/test_base.py'], 'message': "Allow storlet header parameters value to have ':' symbols

Header based storlet parameters have the following format:
X-Storlet-Parameter-<index>: key:value

The current code fails if the value has more then one ':'
symbol. The current patch fixes this behavior.

This facilitates the ability to send a serialized json
dictionary as a parameter.

Change-Id: I9155f4d3dc336806d175e88322a4334efe2de941
"}]
commit_message:
Allow storlet header parameters value to have ':' symbols

Header based storlet parameters have the following format:
X-Storlet-Parameter-<index>: key:value

The current code fails if the value has more then one ':'
symbol. The current patch fixes this behavior.

This facilitates the ability to send a serialized json
dictionary as a parameter.

Change-Id: I9155f4d3dc336806d175e88322a4334efe2de941

- block kombu 4.0 release
    kombu v4 conflicts with oslo.messaging and openstack global
    requirement for mitaka release so we have to block it
    for reviving ostf gates.
- add upper constraint to keystonemiddleware
    4.11 and higher requires python-keystoneclient>=3.6 which conflicts
    with global requirements
- add python-openstackclient requirement
    python-saharaclient requires it but newest openstackclient conflicts

    as mentioned above new saharaclient requires new openstackclient which

Change-Id: I59b371b0d580c020cd7120d8c40c0338b835795b
'}]
commit_message:
Resolve dependencies hell in mitaka branch

- block kombu 4.0 release
    kombu v4 conflicts with oslo.messaging and openstack global
    requirement for mitaka release so we have to block it
    for reviving ostf gates.
- add upper constraint to keystonemiddleware
    4.11 and higher requires python-keystoneclient>=3.6 which conflicts
    with global requirements
- add python-openstackclient requirement
    python-saharaclient requires it but newest openstackclient conflicts
    with keystoneclient
- add upper constaint to python-saharaclient
    as mentioned above new saharaclient requires new openstackclient which
    requires new keystoneclient. pin it to mitaka-compatible package.

Change-Id: I59b371b0d580c020cd7120d8c40c0338b835795b

commit_message:
Correct the wrong calling 'getExternalNetworkIdForRouter'

In 'io.murano.system.NetworkExplorer', there is a
'get_external_network_id_for_network' method calling
'getExternalNetworkIdForRouter' to get external network id for specific
router interface, which should be 'get_external_network_id_for_router'

Change-Id: Id2046106e274b8f6682703659ab8e27233d49209
Closes-Bug: #1638923

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-09 08:58:41.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_rbd.py'], 'message': "RBD: two types of 'volume_type' should be handled respectively.

When creating a new volume, the 'volume_type' passed to
method '_is_replicated_type' is an instance of 'VolumeType', which
has attribute of 'extra_specs'. But when retyping a volume ,the 'volume_type'
passed to the method is a dictionary, which has no attribute of 'extra_specs',
so, the return value will always be 'False', that is means, the volume will
not be replicated. These two cases should be handled respectively.

Change-Id: I35c44df574d88d15526edade1ef56bb3a1c11686
Closes-Bug: #1653917
"}]
commit_message:
RBD: two types of 'volume_type' should be handled respectively.

When creating a new volume, the 'volume_type' passed to
method '_is_replicated_type' is an instance of 'VolumeType', which
has attribute of 'extra_specs'. But when retyping a volume ,the 'volume_type'
passed to the method is a dictionary, which has no attribute of 'extra_specs',
so, the return value will always be 'False', that is means, the volume will
not be replicated. These two cases should be handled respectively.

Change-Id: I35c44df574d88d15526edade1ef56bb3a1c11686
Closes-Bug: #1653917

commit_message:
use osc-lib git master branch

osc-lib bug/1652025 is fixed with
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/417675/
Wihtout the fix devstack fails with router creation with
"TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not iterable".
The fix isn't published at pypi yet. Until the new version of osc-lib
(probably as 1.3), use git master branch of osc-lib.

Change-Id: I11c0a8f106c48c89ac2bb6189fee04cb7c126e01
Related-bug: #1652025

method '_is_replicated_type' is an instance of 'VolumeType', which
has attribute of 'extra_specs'. But when retyping a volume ,the 'volume_type'
passed to the method is a dictionary, which has no attribute of 'extra_specs',
so, the return value will always be 'False', that is means, the volume will

commit_message:
RBD: two types of 'volume_type' should be handled respectively.

When creating a new volume, the 'volume_type' passed to
method '_is_replicated_type' is an instance of 'VolumeType', which
has attribute of 'extra_specs'. But when retyping a volume ,the 'volume_type'
passed to the method is a dictionary, which has no attribute of 'extra_specs',
so, the return value will always be 'False', that is means, the volume will
not be replicated. These two cases should be handled respectively.
Closes-Bug: #1653917

commit_message:
listing revoke events should be admin only

Currently any user can list revocation events, this data contains
IDs for users and projects. It should not be made available to
any user that is able to authenticate, it should be an admin
only API call.

Change-Id: I4290163c67c84ef0e1a2f6ee967ddf2acb2c3212
Closes-Bug: 1649446

commit_message:
Refactor: Move domainEventRegisterAny method in a loop

There are 9 occurrences in the code where domainEventRegisterAny
method is defined in the _virt_event method of the
InstancemonitorManager class.

This patch is intended to move the domainEventRegisterAny
method in a loop to reduce size of code.

Change-Id: Ie827d2ebb7a9bf923a3429ed1ac95fe75dce66f7

subject: Get glance+rally to work under python3
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-01-10 00:44:44.000000000', 'files': ['tests/ci/osresources.py'], 'message': 'Get glance+rally to work under python3

tests/ci/osresources.py:
* specify a key for sorted to work properly under py3x. The response
  from _deduplicate is a list with both strings and lists.
* response from check_output is a byte array in python3, so we need
  to turn that into a string which json.loads needs

Change-Id: Iad684554d4c618bffc394c67ae85d276fbeb7f99
'}]
commit_message:
Get glance+rally to work under python3

tests/ci/osresources.py:
* specify a key for sorted to work properly under py3x. The response
  from _deduplicate is a list with both strings and lists.
* response from check_output is a byte array in python3, so we need
  to turn that into a string which json.loads needs

Change-Id: Iad684554d4c618bffc394c67ae85d276fbeb7f99

commit_message:
H305/H402 hacking have been deprecated

H305/H402 hacking have been removed since hacking 0.10.
https://github.com/openstack-dev/hacking/blob/master/setup.cfg
test-requirements of coverage2sql require hacking<0.11,>=0.10..
So remove H305/H402 ignore statement
Closes-Bug: #1653639

Change-Id: I781fc185b3a70e0c9e12ae0eeab16d2d54925421

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-10 01:30:36.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/session.py', 'keystoneauth1/tests/unit/test_session.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1654847-acdf9543158329ec.yaml'], 'message': 'X-Serivce-Token should be hashed in the log

Currently, logs display the hash values of X-Auth-Token,
Authorization, and X-Subject-Token, but not the value of
the X-Service-Token.  This patch set adds the X-Service-Token

'}]
commit_message:
X-Serivce-Token should be hashed in the log

Currently, logs display the hash values of X-Auth-Token,
Authorization, and X-Subject-Token, but not the value of
the X-Service-Token.  This patch set adds the X-Service-Token
to the list of header fields to be hashed for logging purposes.

Change-Id: I4d996a2631f61a2c9bbbc7f959e97c7279be023d
Closes-Bug: #1654847

commit_message:
Fix the docs error

The docutils 0.13.1 release breaks some documentation jobs
when it tries to build docs with remote images. This has been reported
upstream[0]. The version matches the supported docutils versions for
sphinx. The requirements patch is here: [1]

[0] https://sourceforge.net/p/docutils/bugs/301/
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/409529/

Change-Id: I1ab3a06167798efbb5a3a683947483d1dd1c65d6

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2017-01-08 00:21:53.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v2/contrib/__init__.py', 'novaclient/client.py'], 'message': 'Fix "Message object do not support addition".

In the 7.0.0 Novaclient release we added some warning
log about user should using "endpoint_type" rather than
"interface" when init novaclient:
https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/master/novaclient/client.py#L312-L327

https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/master/novaclient/client.py#L249-L272

This is now causing a lot jenkins failures acroos projects
that is using novaclient with enable_lazy set to False.
As in this kind of scenario the warning message is a message
object instead of unicode sting and it cannot be added:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.i18n/tree/oslo_i18n/_message.py#n227

and "Message object do not support addition" will raise.

Related Jenkins Error:
Ceilometer:
http://logs.openstack.org/29/333129/3/check/gate-ceilometer-python27-ubuntu-xenial/bd125e7/

Closes-bug: #1652414
Change-Id: I11a490f759fdac9707c1321c9659da2605196a94
'}]
commit_message:
Fix "Message object do not support addition".

In the 7.0.0 Novaclient release we added some warning
log about user should using "endpoint_type" rather than
"interface" when init novaclient:
https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/master/novaclient/client.py#L312-L327

https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/master/novaclient/client.py#L249-L272

This is now causing a lot jenkins failures acroos projects
that is using novaclient with enable_lazy set to False.
As in this kind of scenario the warning message is a message
object instead of unicode sting and it cannot be added:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.i18n/tree/oslo_i18n/_message.py#n227

and "Message object do not support addition" will raise.

Related Jenkins Error:
Ceilometer:
http://logs.openstack.org/29/333129/3/check/gate-ceilometer-python27-ubuntu-xenial/bd125e7/

Closes-bug: #1652414
Change-Id: I11a490f759fdac9707c1321c9659da2605196a94

Currently, logs display the hash values of X-Auth-Token,
Authorization, and X-Subject-Token, but not the value of
the X-Service-Token.  This patch set adds the X-Service-Token

commit_message:
X-Serivce-Token should be hashed in the log

Currently, logs display the hash values of X-Auth-Token,
Authorization, and X-Subject-Token, but not the value of
the X-Service-Token.  This patch set adds the X-Service-Token
to the list of header fields to be hashed for logging purposes.

Change-Id: I4d996a2631f61a2c9bbbc7f959e97c7279be023d
Closes-Bug: #1654847

subject: Fix venv build fallback mechanism
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-09 13:57:24.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/keystone_install.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Fix venv build fallback mechanism

Fixes the ability to deploy a venv in cases where:
1) developer_mode is not enabled
2) A cached venv is not downloaded from the repo server

Also introduced is a var that can be used to disable the cached venv
download attempt entirely and force the fallback behavior. Previously
that would have been available by simply setting the venv download
to some broken URL like "http://localhost/none", but
keystone_venv_download will allow for much easier disabling of the
cached venv download behavior.

Change-Id: Ifb07eb2a73cc3478a36177d53a9a2b0579da4e12
'}]
commit_message:
Fix venv build fallback mechanism

Fixes the ability to deploy a venv in cases where:
1) developer_mode is not enabled
2) A cached venv is not downloaded from the repo server

Also introduced is a var that can be used to disable the cached venv
download attempt entirely and force the fallback behavior. Previously
that would have been available by simply setting the venv download
to some broken URL like "http://localhost/none", but
keystone_venv_download will allow for much easier disabling of the
cached venv download behavior.

Change-Id: Ifb07eb2a73cc3478a36177d53a9a2b0579da4e12

commit_message:
Revert "lib/neutron: Remove type_driver configuration"

This reverts commit 1d83a08a385ad079c546d8a0ac9558dc72eaa9fd.

python-novaclient tests are failing with 409 conflicts on
ambiguous network errors when booting a server because we're
seeing a flat and vxland tenant network available and the
tests aren't written to pass in a network ID.

Change-Id: I2506bd74881b4f9004b234d5f60ec5bf3e70724f
Related-Bug: #1654806

commit_message:
Revert "Add filter check for quering"

This reverts commit 22707fb3d2a621d2f632f395f8d77c3f9e83c90d.

It appears that when nova is querying for shared=False
networks the shared part is potentially getting ignored, which
might be due to this patch that's being reverted.

Change-Id: Ia831430b2202bdbfcf5ada382e65f013b96b2e67
Related-Bug: #1654806

commit_message:
Check error message returned by the system

As in If84b7dc1f4b7681169d9041288169d81c5ebe586,
testcases should check the error message returned by
the system, not the error message defined in Tempest,
that is meaningless.

commit_message:
Add orm type check for paginate_query

Cinder rasises 500 error if the sort key is the resources'
object property.

This patch add the type check to prevent querying with non-ORM
propery.

Change-Id: Ia7de86435d4af865c20bcd2b6f9b24ccf3b1dca2
Closes-bug: #1653197

Pecan: Fix subresource policy check

THe policy enforcement hook was not inserting the parent resource name
when checking that a policy action was supported.

subject: Add support for using the default subnetpool
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-01-04 13:31:35.000000000', 'files': ['shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': 'Add support for using the default subnetpool

Allows to pass use_default_subnetpool instead of a cidr. This is
required when adding an IPv6 subnet if BGP or prefix delegation is
enabled.

Change-Id: Icf7c212ee730d631599fba732f66679c5cd2916d
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for using the default subnetpool

Allows to pass use_default_subnetpool instead of a cidr. This is
required when adding an IPv6 subnet if BGP or prefix delegation is
enabled.

Change-Id: Icf7c212ee730d631599fba732f66679c5cd2916d

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2017-01-05 07:46:05.000000000', 'files': ['tricircle/common/lock_handle.py', 'tricircle/xjob/xmanager.py', 'tricircle/network/helper.py', 'tricircle/tests/unit/xjob/test_xmanager.py', 'tricircle/network/local_l3_plugin.py', 'tricircle/tests/unit/network/test_central_plugin.py', 'tricircle/db/models.py', 'tricircle/network/central_plugin.py', 'releasenotes/notes/combine-bridge-network-c137a03f067c49a7.yaml', 'devstack/local.conf.node_2.sample', 'tricircle/common/constants.py', 'tricircle/network/local_plugin.py', 'tricircle/common/client.py'], 'message': 'Combine bridge networks

1. What is the problem?
The current implementation of bridge networks has some problems
when supporting DVR and shared VxLAN network. One blueprint has
been registered[1] and the specification document has also been
submitted[2].

2. What is the solution to the problem?
The logic of bridge network operations will be changed, here lists
some major changes:
(1) Only one bridge network will be created for one project
(2) Bridge network is attached to local router as external network
(3) One local router dedicated for north-south networking will be
    created in the pod hosting real external network. Bridge network
    is attached to this special router as internal network
(4) If the instance port is not located in the pod hosting real
    external network, after floating ip association, one "copy" port
    will be created in the pod hosting real external network. Without
    this port, local Neutron server will complain that it cannot find
    the internal port going to be associated.

3.What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
  to realize the solution?
Bring part of the DVR support to cross-pod layer-3 networking

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tricircle/+spec/combine-bridge-net
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/396564/

Change-Id: I53d1736ab30d3bc508279532609285975988b5f4
'}]
commit_message:
Combine bridge networks

1. What is the problem?
The current implementation of bridge networks has some problems
when supporting DVR and shared VxLAN network. One blueprint has
been registered[1] and the specification document has also been
submitted[2].

2. What is the solution to the problem?
The logic of bridge network operations will be changed, here lists
some major changes:
(1) Only one bridge network will be created for one project
(2) Bridge network is attached to local router as external network
(3) One local router dedicated for north-south networking will be
    created in the pod hosting real external network. Bridge network
    is attached to this special router as internal network
(4) If the instance port is not located in the pod hosting real
    external network, after floating ip association, one "copy" port
    will be created in the pod hosting real external network. Without
    this port, local Neutron server will complain that it cannot find
    the internal port going to be associated.

3.What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
  to realize the solution?
Bring part of the DVR support to cross-pod layer-3 networking

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tricircle/+spec/combine-bridge-net
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/396564/

Change-Id: I53d1736ab30d3bc508279532609285975988b5f4

lib/tempest: remove the identity_feature_enabled.reseller flag.

Now that Liberty is EOLed, all supported versions of OpenStack have
the 'reseller' [1] feature.

[1]: http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/kilo/reseller.html

commit_message:
Rebind DPDK interfaces back to normal driver

List all devices (not only DPDK) to /etc/dpdk/interfaces to make normal
interfaces get back from DPDK.

This patch don't cover a case where the DPDK is fully disabled.

Change-Id: I255fd93d074cccc1e2805d9f2f566d715483e830
Closes-Bug: #1586424

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-14 13:59:59.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/targets/tgt.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/targets/test_tgt_driver.py'], 'message': "Add lock when create tgt target

There's a bug in the current tgt driver, under certain
conditions a race condition is present that can
result in tgtadm attempting re-use a target ID.

Here is the explanation of the root cause:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1398078/comments/29

This patch adds a lock when create a tgt target to deal with
the problem.

Closes-Bug: #1398078

Change-Id: I58fb24dda90aa93fb9d33146c395f9983bf8e7e9
"}]
commit_message:
Add lock when create tgt target

There's a bug in the current tgt driver, under certain
conditions a race condition is present that can
result in tgtadm attempting re-use a target ID.

Here is the explanation of the root cause:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1398078/comments/29

This patch adds a lock when create a tgt target to deal with
the problem.

Closes-Bug: #1398078

Change-Id: I58fb24dda90aa93fb9d33146c395f9983bf8e7e9

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-09 21:58:01.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/tests/unit/test_matchers.py'], 'message': "Don't use private testtools.test module

The testtools.test module is the unit testing module for testtools and
is an internal module with additional requirements. We should not be
relying on this module.

Copy the tests that were exposed from testtools into here.

Change-Id: I1e09228cff7a0c8136447f07df6864045a6fb849
(cherry picked from commit 31b9d125b0a3142ac17e8552911bb507633f05f7)

commit_message:
Don't use private testtools.test module

The testtools.test module is the unit testing module for testtools and
is an internal module with additional requirements. We should not be
relying on this module.

Copy the tests that were exposed from testtools into here.

Change-Id: I1e09228cff7a0c8136447f07df6864045a6fb849
(cherry picked from commit 31b9d125b0a3142ac17e8552911bb507633f05f7)

commit_message:
increases minimum os-vif version.

- This change raises the minimum os-vif version to 1.4.0
- This change raises the upper constraint for os-vif to 1.4.0

Change-Id: Ia89b8353ef6a9a15cff3ce8c77944fb3cb896bf6
Depends-on: Ibbba63846d654f5f8e530703af0c00f204408d43
